greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered length 2 compositions of n with at least one even summand.
comment: (Fourth column of table A210530)/2 for n>2. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Jan 29 2013
link: Index entries for two-way infinite sequences
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
formula: a(n+2)=sum{k=0..n, gcd(n, k) mod 2}; - _Paul Barry_, May 02 2005
example: a(7) = 6 because we can write 7 = 1+6 = 2+5 = 3+4 = 4+3 = 5+2 = 6+1; a(8) = 3 because we can write 8 = 2+6 = 4+4 = 6+2.
xref: Cf. A097140 (first differences), A030451 (absolute first differences), A210530.
results.author: _Len Smiley_, Nov 23 2001
